shapes3d.animation

Class StopWatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes3d.animation.StopWatch

  • public class StopWatch
extends Object
    Simple implementation of a timer that records the current and the lap time (in seconds).

    Use 
    currTime()
    to get the time since the Clock was created or last reset. It is updated on every call to the setLapTime() method.
    Use 
    lapTime()
    to get the time since the last call to the update() method.

    The current and lap times can be automatically updated for you every frame, or if you want more control over when they are updated the you have the option to call the setLapTime() method manually. The version use get depends on which of the two create() methods you use.
    Author:
    Peter Lager

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StopWatch()
      Use this constructor to create the timer.
      StopWatch(PApplet app)
      You must use this constructor Using this constructor means that the gameTime and elapsedTime are automatically updated for you just before the draw method is called.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float currTime()
      Get the time since the timer was created/reset
      float lapTime()
      Get the time between last 2 updates
      void reset()
      Reset the clock.
      void update()
      Update gameTime and elapsed time.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • StopWatch

        public StopWatch()
        Use this constructor to create the timer.
        The timer must be updated every frame.

      • StopWatch

        public StopWatch(PApplet app)
        You must use this constructor Using this constructor means that the gameTime and elapsedTime are automatically updated for you just before the draw method is called. So there is no need for you to call the setLapTime() method.
        Parameters:
        app - the PApplet object

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        Update gameTime and elapsed time.
        This must be called every frame. So if you have a timer object called 
        t
        then at the at the start of the draw() method update the timer with 
        t.update();

      • lapTime

        public float lapTime()
        Get the time between last 2 updates
        Returns:
        time in seconds

      • currTime

        public float currTime()
        Get the time since the timer was created/reset
        Returns:
        time in seconds

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the clock.
